arts.ttl: Enzo Maresca deems Bayern Munich to be ‘very close’ to continental glory
arts.sum: Chelsea have let go of one of their best forwards from the last two years and given him to the team they must face in their Champions League return. “ Bayern Munich is a team that already show last year that they are very close and they can compete in this competition try to win this competition.

arts.ttl: Reece James reveals he ‘didn’t expect’ the exit of a familiar face in Bayern Munich’s squad
arts.sum: With all the change, we started slow, but last season, we came on leaps and bounds.” He has seen the side falter and find their way back to being a competitive unit, but the institution has changed, and he had to accept the departure of a figure he "didn't expect" to go.

arts.ttl: The one stat that emphasises why Chelsea are mammoth CL underdogs against Bayern Munich
arts.sum: While Bayern Munich are viewed as the marginal favourites to beat Chelsea in the Champions League on Wednesday night, one statistic suggests that Enzo Maresca deserve to be mammoth underdogs.

arts.ttl: Bayern's wildcard: Why Jackson can play Chelsea

arts.sum: There’s a repeat of the 2012 Champions League final on Gameweek 1 of the league phase.

arts.ttl: 5 reasons Bayern Munich will beat Chelsea in the UEFA Champions League
arts.sum: Nicolas Jackson will be eager to impress against his former club, and with Harry Kane, Michael Olise and Luis Díaz providing a sensational attacking threat to go with Bayern Munich's UEFA Champions League pedigree, there are plenty of reasons the champions will beat Chelsea in their league phase opener... While a will-he-or-won't-he saga culminated in attack talent Jackson arriving in Munich on an initial loan deal late on Transfer Deadline Day, the Champions League draw the previous week determined that his first European night in a Bayern jersey will come against his parent club, Chelsea.
